Date: Tue, 14 Nov 1995 17:44:16 +0800 (WST)
From: "Greg O'Beirne" <gobeirne@tartarus.uwa.edu.au>
Subject: CRD: "Send His Love To Me" by PJ Harvey


---------------------------------
 Send His Love To Me - PJ Harvey
---------------------------------
transcribed by Greg O'Beirne (gobeirne@tartarus.uwa.edu.au)

Note: Chords are played as E-shape barre chords by one
      set of guitars, and as normal chords by another.


Intro: [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch] [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]    x 4


[ch]Dm[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]Dm[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
Lover had to leave me
[ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]Dm[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]
Cross the desert plain
[ch]Dm[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]Dm[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]
Turned to me his lady
[ch]Dm[/ch]      [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]Dm[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]
Tell me lover when

[ch]G[/ch]             [ch]F[/ch]         [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]
Calling Jesus please
[ch]G[/ch]                [ch]F[/ch]      [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]
Send his love to me

Oh wind and rain they haunt me
Look to the north and west
Send me please his kisses
Send them home today

Begging Jesus please
Send his love to me

Left alone in desert
This house becomes a hell
This love becomes a tether
This room becomes a cell

Mommy Daddy please
Send him back to me


Strings Interlude:   [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch] [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]  \  x 2  
                     [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch] [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]  /

                     [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]F[/ch]     \  x 2
                     [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch] [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]  /


How long must I suffer
Dear God I've served my time
This love becomes my torture
This love my only crime

Oh lover please release me
My arms too weak to grip
My eyes too dry for weeping
My lips too dry to kiss

Calling Jesus please
Send his love to me

Begging Jesus please
Send his love to me


Outro:  Dm C Dm C  (repeat till fade...)


Any Comments/Corrections/Suggestions welcome,
--
Greg O'Beirne
woyf@perth.dialix.oz.au
gobeirne@tartarus.uwa.edu.au
http://www.uwa.edu.au/student/gobeirne/

[Verse 1]
             [ch]F#[/ch]            [ch]A#m[/ch]     [ch]D#m[/ch]
I know your eyes in the morning sun
[ch]Gm[/ch]            [ch]B[/ch]             [ch]A#[/ch]         [ch]B[/ch]
I feel you touch me in the pouring rain
          [ch]F#[/ch]               [ch]A#m[/ch]     [ch]D#m[/ch]
And the moment that you wander far from me
         [ch]G#m[/ch]
I wanna feel you in my arms again
          [ch]B[/ch]              [ch]A#m[/ch]
And you come to me on a summer breeze
          [ch]G#m[/ch]                         [ch]Bm[/ch]
Keep me warm in your love, then you softly leave

[Pre-Chorus]
      [ch]A#m[/ch]                [ch]C#[/ch]
And it's me you need to show

How deep is your love?

[Chorus]
          [ch]F#[/ch]
Is your love, how deep is your love?
[ch]B[/ch]         [ch]F#[/ch]      [ch]B[/ch]
I really need to learn
               [ch]F#[/ch]
'Cause we're livin' in a world of fools
              [ch]D#[/ch]                               [ch]G#m[/ch]
Breaking us down, when they all should let us be
      [ch]B[/ch]
We belong to you and me

Here's another PJ Harvey tab, as compiled by Sean:

Rid of Me (from the album Rid of Me)

The chords are A, F and G, and it's really easy apart from the timing of the
opening bit, which goes:

1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 +
[ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] . [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] . [ch]A[/ch] . [ch]A[/ch] . [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] . [ch]A[/ch]

(Hint: play them all with down strokes, and hit the strings in a steady, eighth
note pulse.  Use your left hand to sound the chords, ie: fret the chord on the
parts where the chord sounds, mute the strings on all the rest (the `.' bits).

This is pretty easy song once you get the rhythm right, you will need a capo on 5th fret.

Here's chords relative to the 5th fret:

[ch]Am[/ch] [0 2 2 0 x x]
[ch]C[/ch]  [3 2 0 0 x x]
[ch]F[/ch]  [3 3 2 0 x x]
[ch]G[/ch]  [x x 0 2 3 2]

Main riff goes like this (simplified):

     [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]             [ch]F[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
E||------------------------|------------------------||
B||------------------------|------------------------||
G||-------0----------0-----|-------0----------0-----||
D||-------2----------0-----|-------2----------0-----||
A||--2-------2--2-------2--|--3-------3--2-------2--||
E||--0-------0--3-------3--|--3-------3--3-------3--||

Try to catch the groove!

Bm D Em G

         Bm          G         Bm    G
What was sent to the soldier's wife
         Bm      G       Bm    G
From the ancient city of prague ?
     F#            D              Bm
From prague came a pair of high heeled shoes
            A                    G
With a kiss or two came the high heeled shoes

From the ancient city of prague

         Bm          G         Bm    G
What was sent to the soldier's wife
         Bm      G       Bm    G
From oslo over the sound ?
    F#            D              Bm

            A                    G
How it pleases her, the little collar of fur
          F#7       Bm
From oslo over the sound

[chorus]
         G           C#        D
What was sent to the soldier's wife
         G               D
From the wealth of amsterdam ?
     Bm                 F#m
From amsterdam, he got her a hat
                 Bm
She looked sweet in that
                    A
In her little dutch hat
         F#7             Bm
From the wealth of amsterdam

From paris, city of light

What was sent to the soldier's wife

From the south, from bucharest ?

From the south, from bucharest

Fin

Artist- PJ Harvey
Song- This Is Love
Tabbed by Busrday

This song has a main riff that is played throughtout the verses.
It is Gm7 and then Fm7 for one stroke then straight back to Gm7
If you know the song youll know what I mean.

Verse 1

I cant believe life is so complex
When I just wanna sit here and watch you undress
x2

Chorus:

     "                 "                "
This is love-love, love-love that im feeling

Verse 2

Does it have to be a life full of dread
I wanna chase you round the table , I wanna touch your hair
x2

Chorus

Verse 3

I can't believe that the axis turns on suffering
When you taste so good
I can't believe that the axis turns on suffering
While my head burns

Chorus

Bridge

Even in the summer even in the spring
You can never get too much of a wonderful thing
(i think this is the same chords as the chorus but im not sure)

Verse 4

You're the only story that i never told
You're my dirty little secret wanna keep you so
Come on out come on over help me forget
Keep the walls from falling on me tumbling in

Chorus ?

I think at some point in the song she plays just the
top two strings in the main riff.

Chords

[ch]Gm7[/ch]  353333
[ch]Fm7[/ch]  131111
[ch]A#m7[/ch] 686666
[ch]Cm7[/ch]  8108888

Richie

From: Heggie David <HeggieD@scot-textiles.heriot-watt.ac.uk>
Subject: CRD:C'Mon Billy by PJ Harvey
Date: Tue, 28 Nov 95 14:15:00 PST


C'MON BILLY

by Polly Jean Harvey
Performed by PJ Harvey
from "To Bring You My Love" LP
Chords written out by David Heggie

Firstly, the song itself is fairly easy to play chord-wise -
there's no hard chords in it at all.  There's a fair amount of
muting of the strings, very like in her other song on the same
album, "Send His Love To Me". No amount of describing would tell
you how to play this - just listen to the record and play along -
 you'll get the hang of it.

The chords used & how to play them are :

     Am    C    Dm    Em e:---0-----0----1-----0-----  Notice how she plays the Am chord
B:---1-----1----3-----0-----  it's played this way (hammering on
G:---0h2---0----2-----0-----  the E and A notes) throughout the
D:---0h2---2----0-----2-----  verses.  Again, to make it
A:---0-----3----0-----2-----  clearer, listen to the record.
E:---0----(3)---x-----0-----

Here's how they fit into the Verse and Chorus :

[VERSE]

[ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
  C'mon Billy,     Come to me
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]   [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]
  You know I'm waiting,  I'll love you endlessly.
[ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]
  C'mon Billy,    you're the only one,
[ch]Am[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]
  Don't you think it's time now you met your on-ly son ?
[ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]
  I remember      our lovers' play
[ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]
  The corn was golden,  we lay in it for days
[ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]
  I remember      the things you said
[ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]Dm[/ch]
  My little Billy,    come to your lo-ver's bed

[CHORUS]
[ch]Dm[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]
  Come home,  is my plea
[ch]Em[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]
  Your home now is  here with me
[ch]Dm[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]
  Come home  to your son
[ch]Em[/ch]
  Tomorrow might never come

[VERSE]
C'mon Billy, you look good to me
How many nights now your child inside ohh - v.unsure about this!
Don't forget me, I had your son
Damn thing went crazy, but I swear you're the only one

[INSTRUMENTAL] for rest of verse

Then just repeat :

[ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
  Come along Billy,    Come to Me

Until the end of the song.
Easy-Peasy.
